intro: Crotalaria dissitiflora subsp. dissitiflora, commonly known as the spreading cowpea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is known for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, making it useful in agricultural settings. It typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its seeds are edible and have been used in traditional cuisines.
